page.title: 10HOSPITALS
page.content: The{Derby City Hospital}which covered 28 acres was completed in 1927.Since then there have been many modern extensions built and the area has increased greatly. There is an East Ward Block and a West Ward Block each providing similiar accommodation. In recent years many things have been done to improve the standards of nursing including two acute geriatric admission wards and a new ward heating system. The{Derbyshire Royal Infirmary}has recently purchased land to enable extensions, costing 15 000 000 pounds to begin. This will provide new beds in ten wards, six to be for geriatric care and the rest for children's treatment. The catering department will be modernised. All surrounding areas will be landscaped or provide much needed car parks.
